page.title: 01CASTLETON TODAY
page.content: CASTLETON is a tourist village of 700 people,in the limestone Peak District of North Derbyshire.It's famous for its show caverns,former lead mines,its Peveril castle,its church and for its semi-precious fluorspar stone mined locally,called Blue John. Castleton church has an August Festival of Art and craft,a chapel and a few shops.There is an annual Garland day ceremony and a village bonfire each November 5th.A church nightly curfew is rung between October and Shrove Tuesday .Lead miners' old Christmas carols are sung each December .There is a Youth hostel and a Training centre(Lindley lodge).The Peak District National Park runs an information centre and has a conference centre at Losehill hall.The village school has 58 children.
